questions.text:
If the system of equations 11x + y + z = –5 2x + 3y + 5z = 3 8x – 19y – 39z = μ has infinitely many solutions, then 
4 – μ is equal to : (1) 49 (2) 45 (3) 47 (4) 51

4 – μ is equal to : (1) 49 (2) 45 (3) 47 (4) 51
questions.latexText: \(If the system of equations 11x + y + z = –5 2x + 3y + 5z = 3 8x – 19y – 39z = \\mu has infinitely many solutions, then  4 – \\mu is equal to : (1) 49 (2) 45 (3) 47 (4) 51\)

questions.latexText: \(Let the line 2x + 3y – k = 0, k > 0, intersect the x-axis and y-axis at the points A and B, respectively. If the equation of the circle having the line segment AB as a diameter is x^{2} + y^{2} – 3x – 2y = 0 and the length of the latus rectum of the ellipse x^{2} + 9y^{2} = k^{2} is \frac{m}{n}, where m and n are coprime, then 2m + n is equal to (1) 10 (2) 11 (3) 13 (4) 12\)
